fields.title: User Level Donation
fields.text_body:
Dear {{ first_name }} {{ last_name }},

Thank you for your donation of ${{ donation_amount }}. Your contribution will make a significant impact on our programs in {{ current_year }} and beyond.

Thank you for your donation! Your contribution will go towards Rhizome's programs, including our annual commissioning of new art, our preservation of digital art and culture, and the daily news and scholarship published through our blog every day. 

If you want to take your involvement to the next level, please consider becoming a Rhizome member. For ${{ membership_price }} a year, you can be the first to know the latest news and events at Rhizome and the New Museum, as well have full access to all the site features. To learn more about our membership program check out:

http://rhizome.org/join/individual/

Thanks again, and let us know if you have any feedback or questions.

We hope you enjoy Rhizome!

Sincerely,

Heather Corcoran
Executive Director, Rhizome

Rhizome is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Your contribution is tax deductible to the full extent of the law. US Federal Tax ID - 13-3995725
fields.subject: Thanks for Donating to Rhizome!

Thank you for your donation! Your contribution will go towards Rhizome's programs, including our annual commissioning of new art, our preservation of digital art and culture, and the daily news and scholarship published through our blog every day. 

If you want to take your involvement to the next level, please consider becoming a Rhizome member. For ${{ membership_price }} a year, you can be the first to know the latest news and events at Rhizome and the New Museum, as well have full access to all the site features. To learn more about our membership program check out:

Executive Director, Rhizome

Rhizome is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Your contribution is tax deductible to the full extent of the law. US Federal Tax ID - 13-3995725

fields.title: Member Level Donation
fields.text_body:
Dear {{ first_name }} {{ last_name }},

Thank you for your donation of ${{ donation_amount }}. Your contribution will make a significant impact on our programs in {{ current_year }} and beyond.

Our Membership program is designed to deepen your knowledge of the field and upgrade your ability to interact with the Rhizome website. The first thing you should do is fill out your Member profile on your Account page. Get your settings in order, fill out your bio, change your icon, add works to your portfolio, add links to your social media sites like Facebook and Twitter, and add whatever else you want the Rhizome community to see or know about you.

http://rhizome.org/profile/edit/

Then check out the benefits that come with Membership:

+ Commissions Voting: Cast your vote for the Member Award during our annual Commission cycle, through which we give out grants to an international group of emerging artists. This special and unique privilege allows Members to browse the hundreds of applications submitted to Rhizome for a view of timely practices and ideas among artists.

http://rhizome.org/commissions

+ Member Exhibitions: Forge new curatorial practices by creating your own online exhibition and share it with the public through Rhizome. This is a great tool particularly for students or budding curators familiarizing themselves with new media art and its themes.

http://rhizome.org/artbase/exhibitions/

+ ArtBase Special Features: Save art works to your profile, curate online exhibits, leave comments and access to full artwork records. All artwork entries are viewable to the public, but Membership allows you to connect with the artist by annotating their work and integrating it into exhibitions.

http://rhizome.org/artbase/

Got questions about membership or your account? Shoot us an email anytime – membership@rhizome.org

Thanks again for being a member and we look forward to seeing you around on the site!

Sincerely,

Heather Corcoran 
Executive Director, Rhizome

Rhizome is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Your contribution is tax deductible to the full extent of the law. US Federal Tax ID - 13-3995725

fields.title: High Level Donation
fields.text_body:
Dear {{ first_name }} {{ last_name }},

Your membership contribution of ${{ donation_amount }} is incredibly meaningful to Rhizome. It will go directly into supporting our programs, all of which strive to advance new media art.

We could not bring our daily articles on the blog, commission new artworks, or organize our public events without meaningful contributions from supporters like you. On behalf of everyone here, thank you for your generosity. 

In addition, your contribution entitles you to a 1-year Rhizome membership. You keep track of your membership benefits on this page in the "Membership Information" section:

http://rhizome.org/profiles/edit/

You can also read more about the benefits of membership here:

http://rhizome.org/join/individual/

Please do let me know if you have any questions at any point about your donation or membership, or if you just want to be in touch - my email is heather.corcoran@rhizome.org.

Thank you again for your generous support of Rhizome.

Sincerely,

Heather Corcoran
Executive Director

Rhizome is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Your contribution is tax deductible to the full extent of the law. US Federal Tax ID - 13-3995725

fields.title: Council Level Donation
fields.text_body:
Dear {{ first_name }} {{ last_name }},

Your membership contribution of ${{ donation_amount }}is incredibly meaningful to Rhizome. Your contribution will make a significant impact on our programs in {{ current_year }} and beyond.

We also warmly welcome you to the Rhizome Council! Donations at the council level provide tremendous support to Rhizome, and, in turn, we'll provide you with council-only events and engagements. We'll be in contact soon with more information about your role on the Rhizome Council.

You can check your account and membership information here:

http://rhizome.org/profiles/edit/

Read more about the benefits of membership here:

http://rhizome.org/join/individual/

Please let me know if you have any questions at any point about your Council membership, or just to keep in touch. Thank you again for your visionary support.

Sincerely,

Heather Corcoran
Executive Director

Rhizome is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Your contribution is tax deductible to the full extent of the law. US Federal Tax ID - 13-3995725

fields.title: Verification Email
fields.text_body:
Hi there,

Thanks for signing up to Rhizome!

Rhizome is a nonprofit organization dedicated to the creation, presentation, preservation, and critique of emerging artistic practices that engage technology.

To activate your account and get started on Rhizome, click here:

{{ verification_url }}
             
Thanks and welcome,

Rhizome

+ + +
Rhizome.org is a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) organization. For U.S. taxpayers, contributions to Rhizome are tax-deductible, minus the value of any goods or services received, to the extent allowed by law.
fields.subject: Please verify your Rhizome account

fields.title: Donation Verification Email
fields.text_body:
Hi there,

Thanks for signing up to Rhizome and offering to make a donation. 

Rhizome is a nonprofit organization dedicated to the creation, presentation, preservation, and critique of emerging artistic practices that engage technology. All of our programs, offerings, and activities are achievable thanks to donations from generous folks like you.

Please click the link below to verify your account and continue with the donation process:

{{ verification_url }}

Thanks again, and welcome to the community!

Sincerely,

The Rhizome Team

+ + +
Rhizome.org is a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) organization. For U.S. taxpayers, contributions to Rhizome are tax-deductible, minus the value of any goods or services received, to the extent allowed by law.
fields.subject: Please verify your Rhizome account

fields.title: Claim Membership Instructions
fields.text_body:
Dear {{ first_name }} {{ last_name }},

Your donation of ${{ donation_amount }} qualifies you for Rhizome membership. To claim your membership, visit http://rhizome.org/register/ and sign up as a user of the site. Make sure to use this email address! Your membership perks will take effect automatically. If you have any problems, please contact membership@rhizome.org for support.

Thanks again for supporting Rhizome!
fields.subject: Claim Your Rhizome Membership

fields.text:
Public User Agreement for Rhizome.org

1. General Information

Rhizome.org is an online platform for the global new media art community.
Although many of our programs and services are available to the general
public, certain services (collectively, the "Member Services") are available
only to  individuals who have contributed a certain minimum amount annually
to become part of the non-public Rhizome.org community (each a "Rhizome
Member"). Member Services may change from time to time. Currently, Rhizome
Members have access to all of Rhizome's content, dating back to 1996. Other
members of the general public ("Public Users") only have access to content
posted in the last year. For more information on becoming a Rhizome Member,
please see http://rhizome.org/support/.

To become a Public User, you must agree to this Public User Agreement (the
"Agreement"). By clicking "I Agree" on this page, you agree to be bound by
the terms of this Agreement. 
To register as a Public User, you must provide your email address, a
password, and optionally, your name, and the city and country where you
live. This personal information, along with any demographic information you
provide, will be stored in an electronic file record ("Your Profile"). We
hold all your personally identifying information in strict confidence, in
accordance with our Privacy Policy, available at
http://rhizome.org/policy/#privacy. It is your responsibility to keep
the information in Your Profile up-to-date.

As a Public User, you will have access to content on Rhizome that has been
posted or published in the last year. There may be other programs or content
made available to you from time to time as well. Your rights as a Public
User are personal to you and are not transferable. Rhizome.org may modify
the terms and conditions of this Agreement from time to time, and such
modifications will be effective upon notice emailed to you at the address in
Your Profile.

2. Your Content

You are responsible for all text, information, and other material that you
contribute to Rhizome.org, whether to email lists, bulletin boards, through
chat or any other interactive feature of Rhizome.org, or that is contributed
from your e-mail address, by any person (collectively, "Your Content"). For
the purposes of this Agreement, Your Content does not include material
submitted to the Rhizome ArtBase, which is governed by separate agreements.

To contribute Your Content, either: 1) you must own all intellectual
property and other rights in and to Your Content; or, 2) you have the
right to contribute works owned or controlled in part by another, in
which case you must submit with your contribution a statement describing
how and by whom you are authorized to contribute the work. In no event
may you contribute any content protected by copyright, trademark,
patent, or other right without the permission of the holder of such
intellectual property or other rights.

If your work incorporates parts of works created by others, you may do
so on a claim of fair use or by license or express permission.  If you
use works pursuant to a Creative Commons license, a link to the license,
and your compliance with the license terms, may provide the necessary
authorization. If you use CC-NC works, please include the legend "NOT
FOR COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION."

You hereby grant Rhizome.org a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free,
perpetual license to: (i) store Your Content on Rhizome.org's servers; (ii)
distribute Your Content on the Rhizome.org web site and through email lists;
and (iii) reproduce, publish, perform, display, adapt, distribute or
otherwise make available Your Content in web sites, books, CD-ROMs or any
other form or medium whatsoever, whether now known or as may hereafter be
developed.

IF YOU DO NOT WISH TO GRANT RHIZOME.ORG THE RIGHT TO REPRODUCE, PUBLISH,
PERFORM, DISPLAY, ADAPT, DISTRIBUTE OR OTHERWISE MAKE AVAILABLE YOUR CONTENT
EXCEPT ON THE RHIZOME.ORG WEB SITE AND EMAIL LISTS, YOU MUST SO INDICATE BY
INCLUDING THE FOLLOWING LANGUAGE AT THE END OF YOUR CONTENT WHEN YOU POST OR
OTHERWISE SUBMIT IT TO RHIZOME.ORG: "NOT FOR DISTRIBUTION EXCEPT ON
RHIZOME.ORG WEBSITE AND EMAIL LISTS."
 
Rhizome.org reserves the right to: (a) edit, adapt or otherwise make changes
to Your Content; (b) not include Your Content in the Rhizome.org web site or
email lists; and (c) remove some or all of Your Content, without
notification, from our servers, from the Rhizome.org web site and from any
other form or media.

Although Rhizome.org encourages thoughtful criticism, Your Content may not
include any material that defames any person, invades or infringes their
rights of privacy or publicity, violates copyrights or other intellectual
property rights or that is otherwise unlawful.

3. Rhizome Content

The contents of the Rhizome.org web site and email lists (collectively,
"Rhizome Content") are protected by copyright under the laws of the United
States and other countries. Other than content posted by Public Users or
Rhizome Members, or distributed by Public Users or Rhizome Members to third
parties, all content on the Rhizome.org web site and email lists is owned by
Rhizome.org and its suppliers. 

You may download and print out Rhizome Content for your own personal,
non-commercial use, provided that you agree to abide by any copyright notice
or other restriction contained in any individual posting and include any
author attribution, copyright, or trademark notice or restriction in any
materials that you download.

Unless otherwise specified in the terms for a particular work you may
not distribute any Rhizome Content, with the exception of Your Content,
for any commercial purposes. You may get additional usage permissions
from a Creative Commons license on a contributed work or directly from a
contributing artist.

Rhizome Content includes material that has been edited, as well as material
that is distributed automatically and without editing or filtering.
Rhizome.org is not responsible for screening, monitoring, or verifying the
Rhizome Content, including with respect to its accuracy, reliability, or
compliance with copyright and other laws. 

4. Disclaimer of Warranty; Limitation of Liability

NEITHER RHIZOME.ORG NOR ITS OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS,
REPRESENTATIVES, INFORMATION PROVIDERS, OR LICENSORS ("AFFILIATES") ENDORSE,
REPRESENT OR WARRANT THE ACCURACY, RELIABILITY, TIMELINESS, OR COMPLETENESS
OF ANY OPINION, STATEMENT OR OTHER MATERIAL ON THE RHIZOME.ORG WEB SITE OR
EMAIL LISTS OR THAT THE SAME IS NON-DEFAMATORY, NON-INFRINGING OF COPYRIGHT
OR OTHER RIGHTS, OR OTHERWISE LAWFUL. YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT ANY RELIANCE ON
OR USE OF SUCH OPINION, STATEMENT, OR MATERIAL SHALL BE AT YOUR SOLE RISK.

NEITHER RHIZOME.ORG NOR ITS AFFILIATES WARRANT THAT THE RHIZOME.ORG WEB SITE
OR EMAIL LISTS WILL BE AVAILABLE ON A TIMELY BASIS, OR WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED
OR ERROR FREE. THE RHIZOME.ORG WEB SITE AND EMAIL LISTS ARE PROVIDED ON AN
"AS IS" BASIS WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED,
INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WARRANTIES OF TITLE OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. 

IN NO EVENT SHALL RHIZOME.ORG OR ITS AFFILIATES BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT,
INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THE
USE OF OR INABILITY TO USE THE RHIZOME.ORG WEB SITE OR EMAIL LISTS.

5. Indemnification

You agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Rhizome.org and its
Affiliates from and against all claims and expenses (including attorneys'
fees) arising out of Your Content or any breach by you of this Agreement. 

6. Right to Terminate Membership or Subscription

Rhizome.org reserves the right to terminate this Agreement, Your Profile
and/or your subscription to any or all of the Rhizome.org email lists at any
time in the event that it considers, in its sole discretion, any conduct by
you, including Your Content, to violate the terms of this Agreement.

7. Miscellaneous

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between Rhizome.org and you
with respect to the subject matter contained herein. No waiver by
Rhizome.org or you of any breach or default hereunder shall be deemed to be
a waiver of any preceding or subsequent breach or default. This Agreement
shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York,
without regard to its conflict of laws rules.

Member Agreement for Rhizome.org

1. General Information

Rhizome.org is an online platform for the global new media art community.
Although many of our programs and services are available to the general
public, certain services (collectively, the "Member Services") are available
only to  individuals who have contributed a minimum amount to become part of
the non-public Rhizome.org community (each a "Rhizome Member"). Member
Services may change from time to time. To become a Rhizome Member, you must
agree to this Member Agreement (the "Agreement"). By clicking "I Agree" on
this page, you agree to be bound by the terms of this Agreement.
 
To register as a Rhizome Member, you must provide your email address, a
password, your name, and the city and country where you live. This personal
information, along with any demographic information you provide, is stored
in an electronic file (your "Member Profile"). We hold all your personally
identifying information in strict confidence, in accordance with our Privacy
Policy, available at http://rhizome.org/policy/privacy.php. It is your
responsibility to keep your Member Profile up-to-date.

Rhizome Members are asked to make an annual financial contribution to
Rhizome.org, with a certain minimum contribution required to maintain active
status as a Rhizome Member. The current minimum contribution is posted at
[add webpage where this will be]. The amount of this minimum contribution
may change from time to time. By making at least this minimum contribution,
your Rhizome Membership is good for one (1) year. If you choose not to make
this minimum contribution, then your Rhizome Membership will be suspended. 
Your rights as a Rhizome Member are personal to you and are not
transferable. Rhizome.org may modify the terms and conditions of this
Agreement from time to time, and such modifications will be effective upon
notice emailed to you at the address in your Member Profile.

2. Your Content

You are responsible for all text, information, and other material that you
contribute to Rhizome.org, whether to email lists, bulletin boards, through
chat or any other interactive feature of Rhizome.org, or that is contributed
from your e-mail address, by any person (collectively, "Your Content"). For

submitted to the Rhizome ArtBase, which is governed by separate agreements.

To contribute Your Content, either: 1) you must own all intellectual
property and other rights in and to Your Content; or, 2) you have the
right to contribute works owned or controlled in part by another, in
which case you must submit with your contribution a statement describing
how and by whom you are authorized to contribute the work. In no event
may you contribute any content protected by copyright, trademark,
patent, or other right without the permission of the holder of such
intellectual property or other rights.

If your work incorporates parts of works created by others, you may do
so on a claim of fair use or by license or express permission.  If you
use works pursuant to a Creative Commons license, a link to the license,
and your compliance with the license terms, may provide the necessary
authorization. If you use CC-NC works, please include the legend "NOT
FOR COMMERCIAL DISTRIBUTION."

You hereby grant Rhizome.org a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free,
perpetual license to: (i) store Your Content on Rhizome.org's servers; (ii)
distribute Your Content on the Rhizome.org web site and through email lists;
and (iii) reproduce, publish, perform, display, adapt, distribute or
otherwise make available Your Content in web sites, books, CD-ROMs or any
other form or medium whatsoever, whether now known or as may hereafter be
developed.

IF YOU DO NOT WISH TO GRANT RHIZOME.ORG THE RIGHT TO REPRODUCE, PUBLISH,
PERFORM, DISPLAY, ADAPT, DISTRIBUTE OR OTHERWISE MAKE AVAILABLE YOUR CONTENT
EXCEPT ON THE RHIZOME.ORG WEB SITE AND EMAIL LISTS, YOU MUST SO INDICATE BY
INCLUDING THE FOLLOWING LANGUAGE AT THE END OF YOUR CONTENT WHEN YOU POST OR
OTHERWISE SUBMIT IT TO RHIZOME.ORG: "NOT FOR DISTRIBUTION EXCEPT ON
RHIZOME.ORG WEBSITE AND EMAIL LISTS."
 
Rhizome.org reserves the right to: (a) edit, adapt or otherwise make changes
to Your Content; (b) not include Your Content in the Rhizome.org web site or
email lists; and (c) remove some or all of Your Content, without
notification, from our servers, from the Rhizome.org web site and from any
other form or media.

Although Rhizome.org encourages thoughtful criticism, Your Content may not
include any material that defames any person, invades or infringes their
rights of privacy or publicity, violates copyrights or other intellectual
property rights or that is otherwise unlawful.

3. Rhizome Content

The contents of the Rhizome.org web site and email lists (collectively,

States and other countries. Other than content posted by Rhizome Members or
members of the general public, or distributed by Rhizome Members or members
of the general public to third parties, all content on the Rhizome.org web
site and email lists is owned by Rhizome.org and its suppliers.
 
You may download and print out Rhizome Content for your own personal,
non-commercial use, provided that you agree to abide by any copyright notice
or other restriction contained in any individual posting and include any
author attribution, copyright, or trademark notice or restriction in any
materials that you download.

Unless otherwise specified in the terms for a particular work, you may
not distribute any Rhizome Content, with the exception of Your Content,

contributing artist.

NEITHER RHIZOME.ORG NOR ITS OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS,

OF ANY OPINION, STATEMENT OR OTHER MATERIAL ON THE RHIZOME.ORG WEB SITE OR
EMAIL LISTS OR THAT THE SAME IS NON-DEFAMATORY, NON-INFRINGING OF COPYRIGHT
OR OTHER RIGHTS, OR OTHERWISE LAWFUL. YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT ANY RELIANCE ON
OR USE OF SUCH OPINION, STATEMENT, OR MATERIAL SHALL BE AT YOUR SOLE RISK.

NEITHER RHIZOME.ORG NOR ITS AFFILIATES WARRANT THAT THE RHIZOME.ORG WEB SITE
OR EMAIL LISTS WILL BE AVAILABLE ON A TIMELY BASIS, OR WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED
OR ERROR FREE. THE RHIZOME.ORG WEB SITE AND EMAIL LISTS ARE PROVIDED ON AN
"AS IS" BASIS WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED,
INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WARRANTIES OF TITLE OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. 

IN NO EVENT SHALL RHIZOME.ORG OR ITS AFFILIATES BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT,
INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THE
USE OF OR INABILITY TO USE THE RHIZOME.ORG WEB SITE OR EMAIL LISTS.

5. Indemnification

You agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Rhizome.org and its
Affiliates from and against all claims and expenses (including attorneys'
fees) arising out of Your Content or any breach by you of this Member
Agreement. 

6. Right to Terminate Membership or Subscription

Rhizome.org reserves the right to terminate this Agreement, your Rhizome
Membership, and/or your subscription to any or all of the Rhizome.org email
lists at any time in the event that it considers, in its sole discretion,
any conduct by you, including Your Content, to violate the terms of this
Agreement.

7. Miscellaneous

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between Rhizome.org and you
with respect to the subject matter contained herein. No waiver by
Rhizome.org or you of any breach or default hereunder shall be deemed to be
a waiver of any preceding or subsequent breach or default. This Agreement
shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York,
without regard to its conflict of laws rules.

Rhizome is dedicated to the creation, presentation, preservation, and critique of emerging artistic practices that engage technology. Through open platforms for exchange and collaboration, our website serves to encourage and expand the communities around these practices. Our programs, many of which happen online, include commissions, exhibitions, events, discussion, archives and portfolios. We support artists working at the furthest reaches of technological experimentation as well as those responding to the broader aesthetic and political implications of new tools and media. Our organizational voice draws attention to artists, their work, their perspectives and the complex interrelationships between technology, art and culture.

Founded in 1996 by artist Mark Tribe as an intimate email list subscribed to by some of the first artists to work online and now a thriving nonprofit, Rhizome has played an integral role in the history, definition and growth of contemporary art engaged with technology and the Internet. Our website is a dynamic, interactive platform, rich in historical resources and updated continually with new art and commentary by a vast community. The Rhizome ArtBase was founded in 1999, as an online archive of digital art containing over 2,500 art works, acting as the bedrock of our leading digital preservation program.

Peter Rojas, Chairman
Fred Benenson, Vice Chair

The current Rhizome site launched on January 17th, 2011.

Project Director Nick Hasty

Lead Developer David Nolen

Design Shual / Mushon Zer-Aviv

Design Assistant Ed Nacional

Additional Design John Michael Boling

DB/Archiving Consultant Ward Smith

Read more about the site development process on our site launch post.

The site runs on a number of open-source platforms, such as Django, MySQL, CouchDB, Mootools, and Blueprint.

Rhizome is located within the New Museum at:
235 Bowery
New York, NY
10002

Phone: +1 (212) 219-1288
Fax: +1 (212) 431-5328

General: info@rhizome.org

Editorial pitches: editor@rhizome.org

Membership and subscription: membership@rhizome.org

firstname.lastname@rhizome.org

• Non-paying users of the Rhizome website can view all of the work in Rhizome’s ArtBase collection for free. They can also sign up to receive our weekly newsletter, Rhizome News; create a portfolio page or profile, and submit work to the ArtBase.
  • Rhizome Members have advanced access to the website and the ability to use a variety of tools. They can view the full record of individual artworks; annotate and comment on works; curate online exhibitions, and vote in our commissions program.
  • Organizational subscriptions are available to institutions, such as universities, art schools, art centers, libraries and clubs. These Subscriptions allow staff, faculty, students to gain access to all of Rhizome.org's features and services for free. For schools and organizations in poor or excluded areas, Rhizome has different organizational access program: contact membership@rhizome.org for details.

Privacy statement

Rhizome.org is committed to protecting your privacy. If you have provided us with your email address or other Personally Identifiable Information, we will hold that information in the strictest confidence. We will not sell, trade, or rent your personal information to others. If you have questions about our privacy practices, please contact us at info@rhizome.org.

Member Registration
In order to access certain services offered at Rhizome.org, you need to register as a user by providing some Personally Identifiable Information, including your email address and a full user name. 

Your full user name may be shared publicly on the site. Other than your user name, we will not disclose your Personally Identifiable Information unless you specifically authorize us to do so, and we will not disclose your Personally Identifiable Information to others unless required to do so by law.

When you register you may also choose to provide additional personal information, including biographical information, as part of your Public Profile. Any information you may choose to provide as part of your Public Profile will be publicly accessible on Rhizome.org. In addition, content that you choose to share on Rhizome.org (including comments, artworks, announcements and discussion threads) will be accessible on the site and via your public profile. 
We may use the information that you provide to invite you to events in your local area, to update you on new developments at Rhizome.org or to send you fundraising appeals. If you don't want to receive such emails, you can opt out on the Rhizome.org web site. You may also choose to complete a voluntary demographic questionnaire. We use aggregated demographic information about our members (such as the total number of members, the countries they represent, their average income, etc.) in our marketing, publicity and fundraising materials.
You can update your information and preferences at any time on the Rhizome.org web site.

Cookies
After you've registered, we use "cookies" to recognize your browser so you don't have to sign in every time you return to our site. Cookies are small pieces of information that are stored by your browser on your computer's hard drive. Cookies are used for convenience and are in no way linked to any personally identifiable information such as your name or email address. Many web browsers allow you to block cookies.

Online Transactions Via the Secure Server
Rhizome.org takes every precaution to protect data such as credit card numbers transferred via our secure server. We use high level SSL and PGP encryption software to receive online credit card information.

Statistical Information
Statistical information such as Web site traffic is collected and logged by our Web server. In some cases, this information is used in creative ways. For example, the Rhizome interface StarryNight records hits for individual items in the Rhizome archive then displays this information visually. This statistical data has no connection to personally identifiable information such as your name or email address.

Notification of Changes
This privacy policy is posted on the Rhizome.org web site. If at any time we substantively modify this policy, we will update this document and notify our members via email.

Support for Rhizome is provided in part by the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs and the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of Governor Andrew Cuomo and the New York State Legislature.
Signing up to Rhizome is free and takes less than a minute.

Our announce channel will connect you to events and opportunities around the world. We welcome you to upload any event, opportunity or job relevant to artists and art professionals. Please make sure information in your post is clear and complete. Our editorial team may choose to re-post your announcement on our blog or in our weekly newsletter, Rhizome News.
This section aggregates user submitted opportunities.
This section aggregates user submitted events.

The Rhizome Jobs board encompasses a wide variety of industries and fields, including technology, academia, the arts, and non-profits. Job postings are $25 for non-members, but Rhizome Members can post unlimited jobs to the board for free. Postings will run on the site until the specified deadline.

You are invited to contribute documentation of your artwork to Rhizome by creating a free account and adding artworks to your user profile. The artwork would be accessible to the public via your profile page. Rhizome curatorial staff invite selected artists to include their work in the ArtBase, which involves assembling more extensive documentation to meet international archival standards.'

Presenting new media in innovative and challenging ways is a key part of Rhizome's mission. Throughout our history, Rhizome has organized exhibitions online and also in the galleries of partner spaces, including our affiliate the New Museum of Contemporary Art. Rhizome also invites our community to organize online exhibitions from our online archive, the ArtBase.

Founded in 2001, the goal of the Rhizome Commissions Program is to support emerging artists by providing grants for the creation of significant works of new media art. By new media art, we mean projects that creatively engage new and networked technologies and works that reflect on the broader social and political impact of these tools and media in a variety of forms. Rhizome defines emerging artist as artists who exhibit great potential yet are not fully recognized within their field. Commissioned works can take the final form of web-based works, works that engage mobile platforms, performance, video, installation or sound art. Projects can be made for the context of the gallery, the public, the web or networked devices. Rhizome Commissions awards generally range from $1,000 to $5,000.

The Rhizome Commissions program is supported, in part, by funds from Deutsche Bank Americas Foundation, the Jerome Foundation, the National Endowment for the Arts, and by public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs and New York State Council on the Arts. Additional support is provided by generous individuals and Rhizome members.

The discussion section pulls together conversation across the Rhizome site. Comments on announcements and editorial posts appear alongside discussion threads. This section also serves as a consolidated archive for Rhizome's old mailing lists, such as Rhizome Raw, and other content posted to Rhizome since 1996. By aggregating different conversations under a single section, we hope to create a growing and lively environment for discussion. We encourage critical and thoughtful engagement in this section.

Our programs, many of which happen online, include commissions, exhibitions, events, discussion, archives and portfolios. We support artists working at the furthest reaches of technological experimentation as well as those responding to the broader aesthetic and political implications of new tools and media. Our organizational voice draws attention to artists, their work, their perspectives and the complex interrelationships between technology, art and culture.

The Download is a new program through which Rhizome shares one work per month for free download. Part curatorial platform, part incentive to budding digital art collectors, the Download highlights new works and encourages display at home-on any screen, computer, or suitable device.

Rhizome's online journal offers original, critical writing about art and digital technology. We aim to encourage in-depth thinking about artists' digital, online, and "internet-aware" practices, and about the cultural implications of new technologies.

Rhizome curates and partners on exhibitions both online and off – whether at our affiliate the New Museum, through the Rhizome.org website or elsewhere across the globe and web. Exhibitions feature contemporary art engaged with technology in all its forms, and its related contexts.
Like exhibitions, events are a moment of collective discourse about topics related to Rhizome’s mission and work. Most events are documented in some form, and available to view through the site here.

Founded in 2001, the goal of the Rhizome Commissions Program is to support emerging artists by providing grants for the creation of significant works of new media art. By new media art, we mean projects that creatively engage new and networked technologies to works that reflect on the impact of these tools and media in a variety of forms.

The event pairs seven leading artists with seven luminary technologists, and challenges them to develop something new—be it an application, social media, artwork, product, or whatever they imagine—over the course of a single day. They unveil these ideas for the first time at this event.

The Download is a exhibition program though which Rhizome shares a new work for free download. Part curatorial platform, part incentive to budding digital art collectors, the Download highlights new works and encourages display at home-on any screen, computer, or suitable device.

Thank you for considering a donation to Rhizome. Your gift will directly impact our ability to fulfill our mission: to support contemporary art that engages with technology.

Gifts of $30 (USD) and above include a Rhizome Membership. If you join at the $1,000 level you can become a member of the Rhizome Leadership Council, benefits of which include a program of studio visits, conversations with tech start-ups, and more. More details about membership levels here.

Questions? Email info@rhizome.org

What is Rhizome?
Rhizome supports the creation, presentation, and preservation of art engaged with the internet and new technology. Founded in 1996 to support an emergent avant-garde of artists working with the Internet, Rhizome began as an informal email list and has grown into a robust web-based non-profit organization that offers multiple programs and resources. Learn more »

Rhizome receives annual support form our community, foundations, and government agencies. We rely on the community we serve for support. The following individuals and institutions donated during the 2013 Community Fundraiser.
YOU CAN HELP!
Rhizome relies on the generosity of our community. Make a donation today or become a member today!
Donate Now!
Rhizome is dedicated to the creation, presentation, preservation, and critique of emerging artistic practices that engage technology.
• Contemporary art and technology, online since 1996.

Internet Subjects is a series of flash panel conversations. Each takes a topic chosen just a week in advance in order to discuss emerging internet subjects and subjectivities in an engaging public forum.
A regular series of online projects and commissions, co-curated and co-presented by Rhizome and the New Museum.

fields.selection_criteria:
• The work’s aesthetic innovation, conceptual sophistication or political impact.

• The work’s relevance to the discourses of new media art and contemporary art in general.

• The work’s provenance, including commissions, exhibitions and collections.

• The work’s refined use of or reference to digital and Internet culture.
fields.access_membership:
• Access to our collection is completely free and open to the public.

• Rhizome Members receive advanced access to artwork records as well as special features throughout the site. Members have the ability to tag works with keywords, add public comments to records, as well as curate works into online exhibitions. Additionally, members receive other benefits such as limited-edition artworks, sneak peaks to exclusive content and discounts on admission to Rhizome events.

• Organizational Subscriptions are available to educational institutions, community art centers, libraries, and museums. These subscriptions allow staff, faculty, students to gain member-level access to all of Rhizome.org's features. Contact Rhizome's Collections and Membership Manager Zoë Salditch at zoe.salditch{at}rhizome.org for more information. For schools and organizations in low-income areas, Rhizome offers discounted organizational access program: contact info{at}rhizome.org for details.
fields.philosophy:
URLs: As long as the work’s original website remains online, we continue to direct visitors to this original site while also providing a link to our archived version of the work. In the event that a URL breaks or the artist can no longer maintain the work, we promote our archived copy of the artwork as the primary link.

SOURCE CODE: Our goal is to leave the original source code of an artwork intact and to always maintain original copies of an artwork’s files. We believe that an artwork’s source code is inextricably bound with the artist’s process and practice, and exemplifies the technological and cultural landscape in which the work was created. As such, source code should always be preserved. That said, there is a long tradition ofintervention in the preservation of traditional artworks, and we believe that suchpractices can also be used to preserve digital art. The need to leave codeuntouched is outweighed by the need to make these important works viewable inperpetuity. If an artwork needs to be updated to comply with contemporary technologies, we create a separate, specially-named copy of the work that we modify as needed, leaving the original file untouched and available online.

IN RESPECT OF THE ARTIST: We respect the artist’s intent and wishes for their artwork. We always seek permission to exhibit and notify the artist when repairing artworks in the ArtBase. While we fervently believe in taking the necessarysteps to make these works viewable, we simultaneously understand that it may bethe intent of the artist that these works degrade in time and we fully respectthese wishes. When artists agree to have their works rehabilitated, we work directly with them to select the best means of representing their work in a sustainable format.

INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY: We believe that the intellectual property of all artists should be protected, and we support open culture initiatives that promote creative and innovative uses of digital materials. Though "all rights reserved" by default, we provide artists the option to assign a Creative Commons license of their choice to their artwork before it is published here on Rhizome.
fields.current_projects:
We are currently developing a broad chronology of media art, net.art, and Internet art, and areresearching the historic relationship between art and technology in order todevelop a more diverse and genuine cultural context for the ArtBase collection.

As well, we are working with early net.artartists to update, repair and provide a stable hosting platform for theirartworks. Stay tuned for updates as this exciting work continues and theseimportant artworks become available in the ArtBase.
fields.mission:
Founded in 1999, the Rhizome ArtBase is an online archive of digital art containing over 2,500 art works. Encompassing a vast range of projects from artists all over the world, the ArtBase provides an online home for works that employ materials such as software, code, websites, moving images, games and browsers towards aesthetic and critical ends. The mission of the ArtBase is to provide free, open, and permanent access to a living and historic collection of seminal new media art objects.

As any artist who has worked with technology for more than a few years can verify – things break. Browser support disappears, software compatibility changes, links expire. At Rhizome, we aim to ensure the longevity of these works, not only to ensure that years from now an accurate record of this period of creativity and culture exists, but also to enable researchers to interact with and observe these materials in their intended forms. Mitigating obsolescence while respecting artistic intent is a direct extension of Rhizome's primary mission of supporting and promoting art engaged with emerging technologies.

Artworks entered into the archive through artists submissions, annual commissions and special invitation. We welcome submissions to the ArtBase – they are reviewed by our curatorial staff on a regular basis.
fields.archival_process:
We store a copy of the original artwork on ourservers, maintained by leading data storageprofessionals. During this stage, a descriptiverecord of the artwork is created, includingmeta-data about the artwork’s technology,content and context.

 

Works are checked for broken URLs ortechnological obsolescence. If repairs are needed,we create another copy of the original artworkand perform the necessary fixes on this copy. 

 

 

We then host the artwork here on our site,providing 24/7 free access and historic context. Our records areshared with other institutions in order topromote the artworks themselves, and to furthercataloging standards for new media and digitalart.

fields.fp_news_excerpt:
Lorem Ipsum Dolar (Tupac Shakur), Photograph taken by Lorem Ipsum (1996) dolar sit amet.

Did you hear about the rose that grew
from a crack in the concrete?
Proving nature's law is wrong it
learned to walk with out having feet.
Funny it seems, but by keeping it's dreams,
it learned to breathe fresh air.
Long live the rose that grew from concrete
when no one else ever cared.

— from Lorem Ipsum Dolar by Tupac Shakur
